definition: either of two lines that connect a horse's harness to a wagon or other vehicle or to a whiffletree, read with difficulty
details:
noun
- either of two lines that connect a horse's harness to a wagon or other vehicle or to a whiffletree
- a drawing created by superimposing a semitransparent sheet of paper on the original image and copying on it the lines of the original image
= synonyms: tracing
- an indication that something has been present
= example: an indication that something has been present
= synonyms: tincture
- a visible mark (as a footprint) left by the passage of person or animal or vehicle
- a suggestion of some quality
= synonyms: touch
- a just detectable amount
= example: a just detectable amount
= synonyms: suggestion
verb
- read with difficulty
= synonyms: decipher
- follow, discover, or ascertain the course of development of something
= synonyms: follow
- make a mark or lines on a surface
= synonyms: draw
- copy by following the lines of the original drawing on a transparent sheet placed upon it
- make one's course or travel along a path
- pursue or chase relentlessly
= example: pursue or chase relentlessly
= synonyms: hound
- to go back over again
= example: to go back over again
= synonyms: retrace
- discover bits of information about or a sequence of information
= example: discover bits of information about or a sequence of information
